summary: A grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. District Court for the District of Virgin Islands to attorney Darren K. Indyke, commanding his appearance and the production of documents related to the 1953 Trust and the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust. The document includes correspondence regarding service of the subpoena and detailed instructions for document production.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: The primary recipient of the grand jury subpoena, commanded to appear and produce documents related to Epstein trusts.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Mentioned as another individual for whom a subpoena was served alongside Darren Indyke.

persons.name: Chris Kroblin
persons.context: Attorney (Christopher Allen Kroblin) who accepted service of the subpoenas for Indyke and Kahn on behalf of his firm.

persons.name: Glenda L. Lake
persons.context: Clerk or Deputy Clerk who signed the subpoena.

persons.name: Gretchen C.F. Shappert
persons.context: United States Attorney for the District of Virgin Islands, whose office issued the subpoena cover letter.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney cc'd on the email regarding subpoena service.

persons.name: Marc Weinstein
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney cc'd on the email regarding subpoena service.

connections.description: Both were served with grand jury subpoenas, indicating they were both targets of the same investigation into Epstein trusts.
Kroblin accepted service of the subpoena for Indyke, indicating a legal representation relationship.
Kroblin accepted service of the subpoena for Kahn, indicating a legal representation relationship.
Both are Assistant United States Attorneys cc'd on the same official email regarding the subpoenas.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Darren K. Indyke was commanded to appear before the grand jury in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued by the Clerk of Court.

events.title: Subpoena Service Accepted
events.description: Attorney Chris Kroblin confirmed acceptance of service for the subpoenas issued to Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn.

locations: 5500 Veteran's Drive, St. Thomas, VI 00802 (District Court)
575 Lexington Ave., 4th Fl., New York, NY 10022 (Darren Indyke's address)
9053 Estate Thomas, Suite 101, St. Thomas, VI 00802 (Kellerhals Ferguson Kroblin PLLC office)
40 Wall Street, 35th Floor, New York, NY (Solomon Blum Heymann LLP office)
1108 King Street, Suite 201, Christiansted, St. Croix, VI (Branch Office of U.S. Attorney)
keyFacts: The grand jury was investigating the '1953 Trust' and the 'Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust' for potential violations of federal and territorial criminal laws.
The subpoena demanded extensive trust documents including formation records, beneficiary lists, bank account information, asset valuations, and records of distributions.
Recipients were requested not to disclose the existence of the subpoena for 90 days to avoid impeding the investigation.
The document shows the investigation into Epstein's financial affairs was active in the Virgin Islands as of mid-2020, after his death.
Compliance could be achieved by providing documents to the serving agent prior to the court date, eliminating the need for a personal appearance.
